Yes, the design doc says "This is intended to be a single resource only" in the algorithm section.

> And is an absolute value that itself must be vertically auto-sized?

What does this mean? Are you asking what is the behavior when you do vertical and horizontal simultaneously?
You don't plan to set either minCount or maxCount by default?
It is possible. We can set minCount to 1 by default and maxCount to Scale.Replicas. WDYT?
Why do we need APIVersion here?
It is important because it is a part of path. We don't want to hard code it.

comments.body: We will add it in a next PR.
Is this generic?  What if I want to scale another resource?  Why do I need to mutate the selector of the resource during scaling?

Currently, the selector is for pods (and autoscaler is also only for pods). You don't need to mutate the selector, please note that it is a part of status. The selector will be set by RC/deployment bind to scaler.

The selector is needed for identifying which pods whose resources need to be observed. That would be needed in the case of vertical auto-sizing, as well.

In terms of scope, it's similar to `kubectl scale`. We could call it HorizontalScaler, but my preference would be to keep it shorter. 

We can decide later whether vertical resizing should be part of this API or in a separate API.
